entry.title: Hello world :wave:
entry.content:
Here’s why I gave up all those productivity and notes taking apps from Evernote and Onenote to Trello, Todoist, and even Dropbox up to a certain extent, then started using GitHub and GitHub Pages with :heart:. It makes more sense, at least for me, since I interact with GitHub daily, so why not use it for everything else. It’s still a work in-progress.

In case you were wondering, this site is:

  • :lock: Designed from the Otto Theme
  • Coded with VS Code
  • Built on Jekyll Docker
  • Published with GitHub Actions for GitHub Pages, and
  • Hosted on GitHub Pages

And, this article is written in Markdown with Paper app.

For starters, you want to have a look at Docsify. It is a documentation site generator with a great community support. Awesome Docsify is a good source of information. I played around a bit with Docsify and wrote a plugin or two as well for my needs, but that was before I picked Jekyll and it’s my personal preference.
